body: I like the equals notation a little more but I see nothing wrong with the "type T => pkg.T" (except maybe that it's a little ugly :)). It's the way symlinks show up in directory listings, for instance. Also, it looks like it describes the indirection perfectly: I create a new identifier here that "points" to the real type there. The other direction seems much less intuitive: it would suggest some kind of import semantics: "import T from pkg.T". This doesn't fully describe what's going on: is T just a local name imported from pkg.T or is it exported? (I also see this as a possible issue with the "import T" syntax).
